boardgame.name: Beyond the Limes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Then Romulus shall receive the sceptre of his race, and found the walls of Mars, and call the people Romans. I have given no limits or duration to their possessions: I've given them empire without end."
Virgil, Aeneid

In Lex Arcana, you are a Custos (warden) of the Cohors Auxiliaria Arcana, sent by the Emperor to the four corners of the world to further the study of arcane lore, investigate forbidden cults, and face the thread posed by dangerous supernatural creatures.

What is happening beyond the limes, near Augusta Treverorum, provincial capital of Germania? Anti-Roman sentiment is growing with every passing day and it seems that provocation by a number of Angles is increasing without any valid reason...

This PDF contains:

a 15 scene adventure set beyond the Germanic limes
a close encouter with new enemies of the Empire, Hunian Warriors


The Adventure is contained in The Mysteries of the Empire I adventures book and is perfect for a one-shot or as a starting adventure for new players and master.

boardgame.name: The Abandoned House
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No one has been in there for years..

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting an old abandoned house in a town, with an overgrown garden.

boardgame.name: The Church of the Swamp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once a holy place, now this partly-sunken temple is a place of danger!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50x50 map depicting a ruined church or temple in a swamp, and a 20x30 battlemap of the flooded crypt beneath.

boardgame.name: Syiosys Dam E-54
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A huge structure - the perfect site for sabotage!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 50x30 battlemaps depicting a modern/futuristic dam. Interior and exterior views of the auxilliary buildings are provided, and the dam is provided both intact and breached.

boardgame.name: Cobalt Book of Kobolds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

I’d rather fight a giant ogres than kobolds. They’ve at least got the sense to try to step on us, fair and square.

Before you attempt to rob a dragon’s hoard and brave the monster’s claws and fearsome breath, a much more challenging foe awaits you: the kobolds making their home outside the dragon’s lair. Those small draconic underlings might be the weakest monsters you’ll ever face, but they’re among the most cunning, most vicious, and most unsporting foe you’ll ever contend with. They line their domain with the most insidious traps ever conceived, and strike from every direction with guerilla tactics that would make an assassin blush. You’d probably be better off letting the dragon eat you, rather than trying to march out through those same tunnels.

The Cobalt Book of Kobolds is a supplement dedicated to our favorite scaly minions, the kobolds. In its pages, you can find detailed ecology notes, balanced rules for kobolds as player characters, and statblocks galore. Additionally, the book comes with a complete Trap Codex, a folio of fair, easy to implement traps for any sort of dungeon or tomb that the party might stumble into. This book is a must-have if you’ve ever wished to bring Tucker’s Kobolds to 5e, in all their canny kobold splendor.

boardgame.name: Secrets of the Silver Mountain Sage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4 characters of levels 8-9

The wizard Yinan, the Silver Mountain Sage, did not want his disciples to dwell on the past, but to prepare for the future. He designed the foremost part of his crypt with public spaces for meditation and learning. To reach the back of the crypt, where Yinan's memorial and tomb lie, one must traverse a series of hallways intended to confound any spirits that might try to enter or leave the tomb. Rumors persist that a treasure is hidden in the crypt, despite assurances from the caretakers that this is untrue.

The necromancer Jaoxia has discovered the treasure's location, but not the magic mantras to reach it safely. Earlier today, she infiltrated the crypt and broke the seal on Yinan's tomb, hoping to find the incantation inside. This desecration caused Yinan's corpse to rise as a jiangshi (or hopping vampire), but Jaoxia used her necromantic powers to enslave the creature. This act of covert impiety has angered the spirits of the crypt, who proceeded to start attacking visitors, running off many and leaving a few trapped inside.

The characters are called in to rescue those people still within the crypt and to determine what has enraged the spirits, so that they may be placated.

boardgame.name: Rollecate: Santa Fe
boardgame.description:
Rollecate: Stations is the first full expansion to Rollecate. It adds 8 new modules to the game that players can choose to add. Each module can be added independently. New modules include Stations, Signals, Switches, Buffer Stops and 4 more.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Combat Arena: Clash of Champions
boardgame.description:
Combat Arena is back, in a whole new incarnation that pits four mighty warriors of the 41st Millennium against each other in brutal combat. Trapped in an inescapable vault by the mad Necron Overlord, Trazyn the Infinite, two to four players must duke it out to earn their chance at freedom.

This sequel to Combat Arena brings back fast-paced, replayable combat with accessible rules, tactical depth, and beautiful miniatures, each with their own unique actions and attacks. Will you emerge victorious?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Moralpanik: Drevet går!
boardgame.description:
Moralpanik - Drevet går! is a humoristic card game by the Swedish singer-songwriter, and comedian Ola Aurell for 2-4 players about morale panic; the overblown and stereotypical reactions to new cultural phenomenons.

As a player, you launch cynical products and try to create controversy around them to make the most money. At the same time, you act as the guardian of morality against your teammates' attempts to do the same.

The more controversial, the more the value of the product increases. But it's always a gamble. If the decency limit is exceeded, the product is withdrawn and you earn nothing.

boardgame.name: Diezlados
boardgame.description:
Author's summary:

Diezlados is the first published role-playing game in Argentina. It is a "generic" system that uses a single d10 with roll under resolution. Player Characters can choose to make effort in actions, achieving better outcomes at the cost of a reduced chance. Combat uses the same mechanics, with effort points becoming both greater chances to hit an enemy and greater damage.

boardgame.name: Eberron Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the wonderful world of Eberron! Twelve moons hang in the sky, with a belt of shattered rocks suffusing it. The twelve Dragonmarked houses rule over all aspects of life, each sponsoring a member of the Twelve, wizards dedicated to keeping the peace. Swashbuckling rogues work alongside ingenious craftsmen, wielding swords and shield and automatic crossbows. Robotic soldiers, remnants of the last great war, tread the streets, living the closest they can to normal lives, albeit typically normal lives as mercenaries. Spellslingers craft works of true arcana, ships that travel the sky, trains fuelled by lightning, and stone tablets that can communicate over great distances.

boardgame.name: Eberron (Non-Dungeons and Dragons Online) Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Eberron is a world of intrigue and swashbuckling adventure, were industrialized magic has started to pull the civilized world out of the medieval technology level it has stagnated at. Lightning rails provide magical transport between countries, messages are passed around the world in an instant through the speaking stones of House Sivis, and even common goods are produced with exceptional quality and speed thanks to magewrights who work magic into their craft. Magical bloodlines form the basis of trading monopolies and thinking constructs now walk among the natural humanoid species. The continent of Khorvaire has only recently emerged from the century long conflict called the Last War, a succession crisis that split the kingdom of Galifar into several successor nations. The war would still be raging, if an unknown arcane accident (or attack) had not completely annihilated the country of Cyre in a single night, transforming it into a mist shrouded wasteland of mutants and wild magic now called the Mournland. Not knowing what (or who) was responsible, the warring nations laid down their arms, but few believe the peace will really last. Already intelligence agencies, mercantile Dragonmarked Houses, religious cults, and secret societies jockey for power, information, and resources that will give them an edge in this new age of peace or the next war that likely waits beyond it. All the while, dragons and fiends, ancient beyond measure, engage in their own intrigues and push agendas beyond mortal ken.

boardgame.name: Lorwyn & Shadowmoor
boardgame.description:
Lorwyn & Shadowmoor

From the introduction:

Lorwyn is a plane of two aspects. Bright and sunny Lorwyn, and dour Shadowmoor. They switch cyclically every 300 years, an unnatural event triggered by the Great Aurora.

boardgame.name: SpongeBob Squarepants
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

"Are you ready, KIDS? I can't hear you! Ohhhh... who lives in a - Wait, who are you?! How did you get here? Still I guess we can't have those kids missing an episode because you felt like barging in here. This is what we'll do..."

boardgame.name: Bring me the Head of the Comte de Saint-Germain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

IN SHORT: You’re nineteen years old and your weird mom’s resentful chauffeur.

THE WORST THING THAT EVER HAPPENED TO YOU: Like a lot of people your age, it’s your parents’ divorce but… it’s complicated. Karen and Leo split up when you were ten and dad somehow got custody. You think it’s because your mother just bailed but you’ve never asked her—too scared of confirmation and besides, she’s here now. That matters, right? Dad was a security guard. Not the mall type, the “armed response to the alarms” type, but he’s in jail now. Someone used codes from his company to pull a string of robberies, and he went down for it. You think it might have actually been your older half-brother Curtis, but you don’t know for sure.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Full 4-colour Softcover (Trident, Inc., d/b/a Atlas Games)

boardgame.name: Deploy or Die
boardgame.description:
A card game for web-developers. Deploy or Die is a card game for 2–4 player and 10–25 minutes.

The goal is to be the first one to successfully deploy the three Deploy cards or remain the last one in the game, while surviving the attacks from your opponents.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: All You Zombies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Did it end in fire, or did the clock reset? No one cares anymore really. Every day you just run and hide from all these zombies. The living are getting fewer and fewer it seems. And those that still have their faculties are on the verge of total insanity.

Do tell your secrets. How have you survived this long?

boardgame.name: Nakarm chomiczka
boardgame.description:
Knock, knock! Little hamsters knocked on your door and their bellies are growling with hunger... What can you feed them? Take a look at the pantries and choose the best treats for your pupils!

Be quick, be careful and grab the right treat before the other players do! Place your Treat Tokens in the hamster's belly and cheeks and remember about a varied diet! Apples, sunflower seeds, carrots, clover, beetroots and more - choose wisely as the space in your hamster's belly is limited!

Crunch, crunch!

Game components include 4 Hamster Player Boards, 1 dice (D6), 6 Pantry Tokens, 4 Hamster Markers and 60 different Treat Tokens.

boardgame.name: Age Appropriate
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Are you sick and tired of being told what to do? Parents getting on your last nerve? Sick of hearing things like "Do your homework! Make your bed! Go to your inter-dimensional prison without dessert!"?

Worry not, true believer, those times are over. In AGE APPROPRIATE, you can take the roles of the Power Pack or your favorite MARVEL SUPER HEROES and be truly independent humans.

Well... Super-humans. Without those pesky adults around, you are truly able to do things that were previously out of your reach: stay up late, sleep in, try some recreational chocolate cake with a talking bunny at a bohemian bar. The World is yours!

Actually, it's Doom's. That might be a bigger problem.
boardgame.rpgseries: MH - Marvel Super Heroes RPG Adventures

boardgame.name: Depleted
boardgame.description:
The earth is a dark, cloudy haze. Breathable air, habitable land, resources are nearly depleted.

You have been sent out from your clan in your ship, the Condor, to find energy generators and return them to your home.

Travel the surface of earth, encounter creatures and items along the way, upgrade your ship, most importantly, find 3 Titan Energy Generators to win the game.

Depleted is a solo adventure game set on a weary dying Earth. A player mat represents your ship. Pay Fuel to explore locations to find resources and allies, and encounter creatures. Upgrade your ship to converse Fuel, add additional cargo bays, strengthen it for combat, and more. Locations, resources, allies, and creatures are all contained on 102 mini-size cards. Combats are resolved by rolling multiple D12 dice.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Altered Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Unlike most RPGs where your characters will become more fearsome and heroic as they progress, in the Altered World, your character will slowly become riddled with hideous mutations. This is a post-apocalyptic RPG system where death may be nobler fate...

Featuring 36 mutations, character generation, stats for familiars, and all the other necessary rules, the Altered World rules pamphlet is all you will ever need when exploring the twisted tracts of these accursed lands.

boardgame.name: The Altered World
boardgame.description:
Basic Rules + Extra Rules

From the introduction:

Unlike most RPGs where your characters will become more fearsome and heroic as they progress, in the Altered World, your character will slowly become riddled with hideous mutations. This is a post-apocalyptic RPG system where death may be nobler fate...

Featuring 36 mutations, character generation, stats for familiars, and all the other necessary rules, the Altered World rules pamphlet is all you will ever need when exploring the twisted tracts of these accursed lands.

User summary:

This item contains all of Altered Goons as well as additional materials.

boardgame.name: Race Across the USA
boardgame.description: Players race across the USA to be the first to visit six states, answer geography questions, then get back to their home states to win the game! Players can use the game board for clues to answer questions and win state cards. Questions are geared to each player’s own grade level, so kids 8 and up from different grades can play together on an even field.

boardgame.name: Big Top Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Heyah heyah heyah! Come one come all! Come see the Biggest Little Show on Earth! Under this tent we see the Molecular Might: Minute Strong Man, Sandor and his Deadly Blades of Terror, the Lovely Lillith and her Deadly Serpents and Luxo: Master of Fate! The big top has it all! Adventure! Drama! Mystery And Clowns! Slap on your greasepaint, slide into your leotard and polish your act. That show must go on!

Big Top Goons deals with the adventures of a ‘family’ of circus folks as they travel from town to town. They encounter adventures, mysteries and all the while try to improve their performance and become a lead act or even get star billing!

The circus, the towns it visits and the adventures encountered are laid out by ...

The Ringmaster!

boardgame.name: Bothered About Witchcraft & Satanism
boardgame.description:
A Game of Depraved Rôle-Playing

From the introduction:

An Anti-Occult Campaigner controls and describes the world to Depraved Youths who then describe how their characters act in the world.

User summary:

The contents of the various versions are identical; the layout varies to facilitate different types of printing.

boardgame.name: Le Sanctuaire de Bronze
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Les légendes parlent d'un poste de garde, d'une place forte depuis longtemps abandonnée : la Tour de Bronze. Elle s'élevait sur les flancs mêmes des Montagnes Noires, par delà la Forêt Ténébreuse. Elle marquait la frontière du royaume. C'était avant les guerres contre les gobelins, avant la mort du roi et la chute du royaume.

Aujourd'hui, de la tour il ne subsiste plus guère que les fondations, quelques murs envahis par les hautes herbes et le lierre. L'endroit est sinistre et désolé, peuplé uniquement par les fantômes des gardiens de jadis et le souvenir des furieux combats qui s'y sont déroulés.

boardgame.name: Goon Squad Skirmish Rules
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The goal is to establish dominance over the battlefield.

User summary:

A set of miniatures combat rules for the game.

boardgame.name: Spells for Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a level-less spellcasting system and spell list.

boardgame.name: TG:0
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You wake in a room you’ve never seen before, with no memory of how you got there. Truthfully, you can’t remember much of anything beyond your name. Your life and your memories are a distant haze, with a few sharp edges desperately trying to poke through. You have a small pack, but it holds no answers. You don’t even think the things inside it belong to you, they feel foreign in your hands. Behind you, other shapes begin to stir. They all wear the same look on their faces. None of them know how they got here. None of them know you. Suddenly, a door appears where there once was none. Something beyond your comprehension is at play here. You and few others stand, throwing your packs upon your shoulders. You know not what you seek beyond answers. You hope that you are fortunate enough to find them.

User summary:

An alternate character creation system.

boardgame.name: Liber Goonica vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Optional rules for Tunnel Goons.

boardgame.name: Voir Mordheim et Mourir!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Voir Mordheim et Mourir, un vieil adage déjà connu dans tout l'Empire bien avant que la cité ne soit frappée par le feu de Sigmar, encore plus vrai aujourd'hui alors que les rues et les quartiers de Mordheim sont le cadre d'affrontements sanglants pour la possession d'artefacts magiques et de la précieux Malepierre.

boardgame.name: Cardcaptors
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Each Episode, a Judge controls and describes the world and its NPCs to the Players, who then describe how their PCs act in the world. Somehow, the PCs have unleashed a set of magical Cards in a city near Tokyo, Japan. They are now tasked with capturing them all before it is too late. In the first Episode, explain how this came to be.

boardgame.name: Tri Tac Systems Dungeon Maps
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Over 24 maps of varing [sic] scale that make great dungeons.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: The DM's Book of Nasty Tricks and Misfit Magic
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome, my fellow DM's. Are your players getting around the evil traps set for them? Is your campaign becoming dull, as monsters are obliterated and players cart enough gold out of your dungeon to pave streets with it? Are they killing those hard-created monsters of yours? Are they trashing a week's hard campaign management and design in an our, and then looking for more?

Fear no more.

The DM's Book of Nasty Tricks & Misfit Magics is a hellish compendium of ideas, tricks, traps, and specially designed material to help any fantasy campaign. This book is a DM's guide to monstrous ideas that will liven any game, as you put the fear of death back into your players. Along with new ideas are many useful tables and charts that can add random events to liven your campaign. The rear of the book is a new idea called Fantasy Real Estate, page of places for sale that your adventurers can buy to call home.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Bernpyle #2 (Winter 2020/21)
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

It is here! The sequal to Bernpyle and the Grizzy Revelation at Badger Burrow. In Issue #2 of Bernpyle you will be introduced to the Earldom of Bernpyle and the surrounding Feylands. Jammed into this zine is an Adventure Site, a Hex Map, a Dungeon, some super powerful Magical Items and much more. Grab a copy, roll some dice and play some mice!

boardgame.name: Bernpyle #1 (Fall 2020)
boardgame.description:
Bernpyle is an unofficial zine and supplement source for Mausritter and is compatible with the Mausritter gaming system.

FALL2020 Edition -

- A Grizzly Revelation at Badger Burrow (Adventure)
- Foraging in Human Settlements (Table)
- Songvogel | A Maus Field Guide to Songbirds and other Perching Avians (Playable Race)
- Mauspanzer | A "Tacti-Cool" Guide to Warband Scale Mounts (Rule Supplement)
- OSR Style Alternative Character Sheets

boardgame.name: Macross 2050 Role Playing Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Macross was a 36 episode anime TV series that aired in 1982-1983, about war, mecha, the human spirit and a love triangle. In 1984, Macross: Do You Remember Love was released. DYRL was a movie version concentrating on the actual war with Boddole Zer, supposedly made by the people on the Macross in 2030 to remember and honor those who died in the war. Macross Flashbask 2012 was a series of Minmei music videos released in 1987, including one new song never shown in the series, showing the launch of the first colonization fleet lead by the Megaroad-1, escorted by VF-4G fighters. The original Macross saga has become somewhat disjointed from the rest of the story since it was created long before the other parts.

In 1994-1995, Macross Plus was released. Macross Plus is yet another story with a love triangle and some of the best animation ever created, first released as a 4 part miniseries and then later as a “movie” version (originally meant as the movie version).

The story was continued with another TV series of 49 episodes, Macross 7 (also aired on TV in 1994-1995). The usual love triangle is more subdued and there is more emphasis on the music and “culture”. Macross 7 also has a 4 part sequel – Macross 7: Dynamite (1997-1998), as well as the 3 part addition – Macross 7: Encore, and a minimovie – Macross 7: The Galaxy is Calling Me. Macross 7 Trash and Macross 7: Mylene Beat carry on the story about the Macross 7 fleet in manga.

A new installment of the Macross legacy is the 5-part Macross Zero released in 2003-2004, which tells the story of Roy Fokker two years before the original Macross series, piloting one of the VF-0 prototypes. It presents new background information that was never presented in the past. One such instance was the discovery of a Protoculture relic on the bottom of the ocean near the Pacific island of Mayan, and that the natives of that island followed a belief based on the Protoculture as divine beings. This new series partially pushes the original Macross saga somewhat out of line with the rest of the story since the original Macross did not make mention of some of the elements shown in Macross Zero and other parts of the saga. Hopefully this will be addressed by Studio Nue.

In 2008, Macross Frontier is released. This sequel to Macross 7 is set in 2059 with the 25th Macross Colonial Fleet (11th super long-distance colony fleet) and their encounter with the insect-like Vajra and a renegade colony fleet. The TV series will be followed up by two movies; the first a retelling of the series, and the second being a sequel to the series/first movie.

Without permission or information from Studio Nue, Bandai Visual released Macross II: Lovers Again, in 1992. Macross II takes place in 2092 as another invading army (the Mardook) leading Zentraedi forces nearly annihilates Earth again. Studio Nue eventually buys rights to Macross II and hides it on the back shelf, calling it an “alternate reality”.

The official Macross story is also carried on through some video games. Macross Digital Mission VF-X (1997) and Macross Digital Mission VF-X 2 (1999) for the PSX, Macross 2036 for the Sega CD (1992) and Macross M3 (2001) for the Sega Dreamcast all are side stories that take place between and after the anime series’. There are several games released that take place in or aside from the canon storyline that do not contribute any new information (mostly shooting games and the like).

boardgame.name: Macross 2050 Game Master's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Macross saga stretches over a span of roughly 60 years, with every decade or so providing different campaign options.
...
[This book] has many useful reference charts and compiled information for the GM's use.

boardgame.name: New Unity Government
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the first sourcebook for Macross 2050. It contains more in-depth information about the Earth United Nations/New Unity Government and their forces, troops, and mecha. It will contain minimal information about the Zentraedi for playing micronized Zentraedi in the UN Spacy forces (for further details on the Zentraedi, see Sourcebook 2 – Protoculture).

boardgame.name: Galaxy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the third sourcebook for Macross 2050. This book contains the information about any groups not covered in the previous two sourcebooks, as well as information to create new star systems to explore and colonize.

boardgame.name: Macross II: Lovers Again
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the fifth sourcebook for Macross 2050. It contains information for the Mardook Army as presented originally by Palladium Books, as well as information to use the Mardook in the Macross canon storyline. This book is purely optional for a Macross 2050 campaign, and the GM is neither required nor encouraged to use it.

boardgame.name: Southern Cross
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the sixth sourcebook for Macross 2050. Although Southern Cross originally had nothing to do with Macross, they have been irrevocably tied together by the butchery of Carl Macek that is known as RoboTech. Super Dimensional Cavalry Southern Cross became the second chapter of the RoboTech saga (The Robotech Masters arc), being rewritten to be the children of the Macross characters.

boardgame.name: Genesis Climber MOSPEADA
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the seventh sourcebook for Macross 2050. Although Mospeada originally had nothing to do with Macross, they have been irrevocably tied together by the butchery of Carl Macek that is known as RoboTech. Genesis Climber MOSPEADA (pronounced moss-pee-dah) became the third chapter of the RoboTech saga (The New Generation arc).

boardgame.name: Protoculture
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the second sourcebook for Macross 2050. It contains more in depth information about the Protoculture, Zentraedi, Protodeviln and Varauta.

For ease of reference, “Zentraedi” refers to the race as a whole, while Zentran and Meltran will be used to refer specifically to the male and female forces, respectively. Also, the Zentraedi in this book assume reference to the forces that have never contacted Earth’s culture.

boardgame.name: Robotech
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the eighth sourcebook for Macross 2050. This book repeats the elements from Macross, Southern Cross, Mospeada and Megazone 23 as they were presented by Harmony Gold as Robotech. Names and information will be shown as it was in the Robotech story, with any other needed parts invented. This book will not cover Robotech III (Orguss) or Robotech 3000 since neither animation went into production. However it does cover what Sentinels information is available, as well as the new Shadow Chronicles material.
...
This sourcebook will not include adventure information from the Robotech RPG by Palladium books, which can be converted with minimal difficulty[.]

boardgame.name: Tech Manual
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the fourth sourcebook for Macross 2050. This book contains all of the information about all of the mecha and capital ships of the UN Military, the Zentraedi, Anti-UN forces and Varauta that have ever been used. It also has basic weapons, armor, technology and equipment for civilian or other use. A lot of the mecha and capital ships are reprinted in previous books, and are compiled in one sourcebook here. This is the compiled book of equipment and technology used in Macross. This manual does not include information from Sourcebooks 5 through 8.

boardgame.name: Evangelion Card Game: EV-01
boardgame.description: Evangelion Card Game Shinji Ikari & Rei Ayanami Set EV-01

boardgame.name: Evangelion Card Game: EV-02
boardgame.description:
Evangelion Card Game Asuka Shikinami Langley & Kaworu Nagisa Set EV-02

Contains:

108 Cards (2 decks of of 54 cards)
12 Double-Sized Cards
2 Turn Sequence Cards
A Playmanual (Japanese, Chinese, English, French, Italian, German, Latin-American Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese)
2 Play Sheets

boardgame.name: Wizards of Mickey: First Age
Wizards of Mickey: Origines
boardgame.description:
Wizards of Mickey Gioco di Carte Collezionabili is a brand new Collectible Card Game licensed by Disney. It has been published in italian only in February 2008.
Inspired by Disney comic books "Wizards of Mickey", in this game all-time popular Disney characters like Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Goofy, but also popular villains like Pet-Leg-Pete, Magica De Spell, the Beagle Boys (for the first time-ever with names!), and the arch-villain Phantom Blot are all there, but with many new twist (an "evil" Mickey Mouse? a real self-determined Minnie or Daisy that will save the day? Pluto as a were-dog?).
The game is an easy to learn collectible game, very fast (10-15 minutes for a single match), Teams of three wizards will challenge each other in magical castles, to obtain "diamagics" (magical gems that can also activate mage powers sometime). First team to grab 6 diamagics wins. Sounds easy? It is, but the game is deeper than it seems at a first glance!
Beautiful Disney artworks illustrate a set of over 150 cards.

boardgame.name: Solutions
boardgame.description:
It’s a race against time to fight climate change. You and your friends must work together to reduce global emissions before it’s too late! As you strategically deploy various climate solutions, you will be tested on your knowledge and your ability to prioritize. You will need to think critically about each solution and discuss with your teammates in order to avoid catastrophe.

Solutions is a collaborative, discussion-based game. The solutions in this game are based on Project Drawdown: a framework of climate solutions, developed by a collaboration of over 200 scientists. Project Drawdown shows a path forward to how we can beat climate change by the year 2050. They have ranked 76 climate solutions based on how much impact they can realistically have between 2020-2050, based on technology trends, adoption trends, economics, carbon lifecycle analysis, and more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Deadpool & Bob, Agent of Hydra
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Deadpool character pack, brought to you by me: the amazing Deadpool! Once terminal cancer patient Wade Wilson, I, the aforementioned Wade Wilson, was transformed into the incredible superpowered hero Deadpool! Thanks to the nerds at the Weapon X program, I was granted an off-the-charts healing factor which allows me to recover from even the most gruesome “for the love of all that’s holy, look away Timmy!” injuries. I’m also basically a ninja–expert marksman, a master in multiple martial arts (including the deadliest of all, Karate), and I speak, like, nine languages. But my greatest superpower of all is my dazzling wit and immeasurable charm. Though teams like the X-Men and Avengers would literally kill to have someone like me on their roster, I, the aforementioned Wade Wilson, a.k.a. Deadpool, remain los lobos–a lone wolf who hunts the moonlight desert in search of the only meal that will satisfy my endless hunger–justice! Also, they haven’t been returning any of my calls or emails…

A cowardly young man, Bob was persuaded to join the criminal organization Hydra by his wife, who accused him of not being able to hold down a steady job. The thought of a stable career with a dental plan also appealed to Bob, though he was ultimately disappointed to find out that Hydra does not, in fact, offer full dental like A.I.M. Bob’s life was forever changed when he met Deadpool during the Merc with a Mouth’s assault on his outpost. Deadpool convinced Bob to assist him with his mission and the two became lifelong partners. These days the H on Bob’s chest no longer stands for Hydra but Hero!

listing.notes: Title: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Deadpool & Bob, Agent of Hydra Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Flock of Seagulls
boardgame.description:
Flock of Seagulls was created as we wanted a game to slap down on seagulls, they are chip thieves.
Flock of Seagulls is a 2-5 playing card game, in which players must try and win all the cards in the deck. Cards are shuffled and dealt evenly to all players.

You win the centre pile by slapping down on the following scenarios - Good Food Card – Trio of Seagulls in a Row – Two Ice Cream Seagulls. However, there are various Bad Food Cards and special cards in the pack to which if slapped on, that player must forfeit 3 cards to the centre pile.
Special cards like the Pirate Seagull have been added, whereby once lain, all players must shout Parlay and the last player to do so, forfeits 3 cards to the centre pile.

If the Mob Card is lain, that player can shout mob before the next player lays their card and claim 5 cards from any player.
This game can be played for 1 minute or 15 minutes, it all depends on how good you are at spotting the difference between the cards.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Last Train out of Rakken-Goll
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

An invitation from Sir Willard Vorstaten leads the Travellers to Rakken-Goll, a dying cattle town in the middle of nowhere. Instead of the expected job offer the Travellers find a lonely young man desperate for offworld visitors. Sir Willard’s residence is comfortable and he is generous; perhaps the Travellers will enjoy some downtime at his expense? Perhaps he might be a useful contact to cultivate; who knows where his duties as a noble will take him next?

Events around Rakken-Goll overtake the Travellers’ plans. Fire, flood and feuding threaten to wipe out the town’s economy and perhaps even destroy it. Sir Willard has the authority to act and he is eager to do right… but he is inexperienced and indecisive. He invited the Travellers because he wanted to make some friends, but now he needs allies… allies who can help him stop the last train out of Rakken-Goll.

Publisher's blurb:

Events around Rakken-Goll have overtaken the Travellers’ plans. Fire, flood and feuding threaten to wipe out a town’s economy and perhaps even destroy it. Sir Willard has the authority to act and he is eager to do right… but he is inexperienced and indecisive. He invited the Travellers because he wanted to make some friends, but now he needs allies… allies who can help him stop the last train out of Rakken-Goll.

boardgame.name: Drinaxian Companion
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Drinaxian Companion is an expansion to both the Trojan Reach and the Pirates of Drinax campaign, and useful for any and all pirate-based adventures in Traveller.

This volume presents additional rules and adventure possibilities, along with a useful summary of the Pirates of Drinax campaign and locations featured within it. New aspects of the Trojan Reach sector are explored with Central Supply Catalogue and High Guard additions that cover the Sindalian Empire, base building, and new starships such as the Rorix Command Vessel, Cestion Strike Boat, and the ECITS modular system that permits the quick and easy customisation of a standard vessel to accommodate a massive range of functions.

Inside you will find:


Guidance on running the campaign with new perspectives and schemes the Travellers can attempt.
A complete Assets and Factions system, allowing the Travellers to build a network of havens and supporting organisations across the sector.
A detailed look at the nature of piracy and counters to it.
Rules for building pirate bases from scratch, ensuring there is always a safe place to run to when the Imperial Navy arrives.
A deep dive into specific locations and patrons found within the Trojan Reach.
Stories From Sindal, a system that allows Travellers to research and chase up rumours of caches and other secrets from the lost Sindalian Empire.
Personalities and factions from the Trojan Reach, ready to be inserted into any campaign,
First Prize, an introductory adventure that can be played before Pirates of Drinax to introduce Travellers to the wonderful world of piracy!


The Drinaxian Companion also includes the following ebooks:


The Torpol Cluster
Theev
Friends in Dry Places
Gods of Marduk
Liberty Port
Lions of Thebus
Revolution on Acrid
The Cordan Conflict
Harrier Class Commerce Raider
Ship Encounters


Additional blurb from the publisher's web site:

The Drinaxian Companion is an expansion to both the Trojan Reach and the Pirates of Drinax campaign, and useful for any and all pirate-based adventures in Traveller.

boardgame.name: Lovecraft's Untold Stories
boardgame.description:
Lovecraft’s Untold Stories is an action rogue-lite with RPG elements. You explore randomly generated levels based in H.P. Lovecraft stories, fighting cultists and all kinds of monsters from the Mythos, improving your weapons and gear, solving puzzles and challenges, and looking for clues and knowledge to defeat the Great Old Ones and the Outer Gods.

LIVE H.P. LOVECRAFT’S STORIES
Lovecraft’s Untold Stories is based on H.P. Lovecraft’s stories. You will experience first-hand the cosmic horror created by the genius of Providence. Every character will go through an investigation that will take them through different locations, from the creepy old Victorian mansion to the abandoned hospital where forbidden experiments take place or the jungle where lost tribes celebrate forgotten rituals, just to name a few. Levels are randomly generated: it will be a different experience every time you play. Also, they vary depending on the character you’re playing with. Look for items and clues to unlock secrets and new stories!

5 CHARACTERS, 5 WAYS OF FIGHTING THE MYTHOS
You can play as 5 different characters, each with a different playstyle and storyline. A private detective, a witch, a thief, a professor, and even a ghoul—each with different stats, weapons, and combat moves, creating five entirely different gameplay experiences. The Detective offers a balanced playstyle, with average Health and Stamina. The Professor is a specialist in ranged combat, with less Health and a special shield granted by his weapon, the Tillinghast. The Witch does a lot of damage, has teleport abilities and elemental shields of fire and ice, but also a very low Health. The Thief is a specialist in melée combat that takes advantage of its stealth to maximize her damage. The ghoul does a lot of melée damage, has a high Health and regenerates itself, but can’t use medkits at all.

DISCOVER THE SECRETS OF THE GREAT OLD ONES
The truth of the dark horrors that inhabit the universe is unbearable for any human mind. In the end, you can’t win against the Old Ones. Madness or death await you. But maybe you can delay the inevitable… If you face the Great Old Ones without any knowledge about them, you will go mad just by looking at their hideous features. But spread across every level you will find special items with information about the Great Old Ones. The more you know about them, the stronger your mind shall become – but knowledge is not easy to find, and if you are not thorough in your investigation you might get to the end of a storyline without finding everything that is to know. You will have to play with all the characters if you want to find all the information about every Great Old One!

MADNESS AWAITS
Insanity crawls behind every corner for those who face the Mythos. In your investigations, you will face different situations where you have to choose what to do – make the wrong decision and you will start losing your mind. In order to face the Great Old Ones, you need knowledge, and to find it you have to explore – but the more you explore the more events that shake your sanity you will find… Those who go mad under the influence of the Mythos take their own life to escape the eternal terror they are now looking at. Not all hope is lost, though – there are some ways to recover your sanity...

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Capitaine Flam
boardgame.description: Captain Flam is a game of skill. The game board is inside the box. It consists of a starting area, 3 cavities and many holes. On his turn, the player must throw a spinning top from the starting area and take the box in his both hands. By handling it, he orients the spinning top towards the holes. Some will allow him to beat monsters that make him earn 1 to 5 points, to replay or lose his turn. If the top falls into a black hole, the player loses an already won monster. When all 9 monsters have been defeated, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Commodore 1570
boardgame.description:
The Commodore 1570 is a 5¼" floppy disk drive for the Commodore 128 home/personal computer. It is a single-sided, 170 kB version of the Commodore 1571, released as a stopgap measure when Commodore International was unable to provide sufficient quantities of 1571s due to a shortage of double-sided drive mechanisms (which were supplied by an outside manufacturer). Like the 1571, it can read and write both GCR and MFM disk formats. The 1570 utilizes a 1571 logic board in a cream-colored original-1541-like case with a drive mechanism similar to the 1541's except that it was equipped with track-zero detection. Like the 1571, its built-in DOS provides a data burst mode for transferring data to the C128 computer at a faster speed than a 1541 can. Its ROM also contains some DOS bug fixes that didn't appear in the 1571 until much later. The 1570 can read and write all single-sided CP/M-format disks that the 1571 can access.

Although the 1570 is compatible with the Commodore 64, the C64 isn't capable of taking advantage of the drive's higher-speed operation, and when used with the C64 it's little more than a pricier 1541. Also, many early buyers of the C128 chose to temporarily make do with a 1541 drive, perhaps owned as part of a previous C64 setup, until the 1571 became more widely available.

The drive uses the CPU MOS 6502, floppy controller WD1770 or WD1772, I/O controllers 2x MOS Technology 6522 and 1x MOS Technology 6526.

Source: Wikipedia, "Commodore 1570", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Total War: WARHAMMER III
boardgame.description:
The cataclysmic conclusion to the Total War: WARHAMMER trilogy is coming. Rally your forces and step into the Realm of Chaos, a dimension of mind-bending horror where the very fate of the world will be decided. Will you conquer your Daemons… or command them?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Commodore 1571
boardgame.description:
The Commodore 1571 is Commodore's high-end 5¼" floppy disk drive. With its double-sided drive mechanism, it has the ability to use double-sided, double-density (DS/DD) floppy disks natively. This is in contrast to its predecessors, the 1541 and 1570, which can fully read and write such disks only if the user manually flipped them over to access the second side. Because flipping the disk also reverses the direction of rotation, the two methods are not interchangeable; disks which had their back side created in a 1541 by flipping them over would have to be flipped in the 1571 too, and the back side of disks written in a 1571 using the native support for two-sided operation could not be read in a 1541

Source: Wikipedia, "Commodore 1571", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Cards of Candour
boardgame.description:
Have you ever wanted to skip to the part of the evening when everyone starts revealing the hilariously weird things they’ve thought and done?

The game consists of 300 question cards that were carefully devised to help you uncover the hilarious inner thoughts, secrets and stories that your friends never even knew they were keeping from you.

The game dice guides you to ask other players personal questions that you think that they might say yes to - if they say yes you win points. So the game has an infinite-combinations-dynamic of revealing both what a person has thought, felt or done, but also what the asker thinks that they might have thought, felt or done.

Philosophically the creators of Cards of Candour believe that "we are all weird, now it’s time to share."
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Cards of Candour: Real Friends Expansion

boardgame.name: Cards of Candour: Real Friends Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Real Friends Expansion contains 50 darker and more inquisitive cards about sexual exploration, death and relationships.

These cards are not safe for work, families or acquaintances.

Save them for your real friends and shuffle them into the First Edition box to add a little pepper and spice to your evening.

boardgame.name: Времена и эпохи: Смута
boardgame.description:
The beginning of the 17th century.
The Russian kingdom is going through a turning point - the Time of Troubles.
In the absence of a sovereign on the throne, fierce battles for the land unfolded in the country.
Choose one of the opposing sides in the board game Times and Epochs: Troubles and create your own history of the Russian kingdom.

In the battle for the land, you play for one of four sides: the Russian kingdom, the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth, Sweden or the Crimean Khanate.
At the beginning of the game, you will have only three commanders, several types of troops and a small territory at your disposal. But with each turn you will expand your territories, create buildings and strengthen your political position.
The entire game is broken down into six long turns of four phases: winter, spring, summer and autumn.

Each season, participants take turns performing a series of activities. In winter, they plan to seize territories and erect buildings, in the spring they receive policy tokens and participate in trading in neutral lands, in the summer they receive income and buy troops, and in the fall they harvest crops and use tokens of neutral military leaders. In addition, one of five military maneuvers is performed in each phase.

The main goal is to complete certain missions and get victory points for them.
At the end of six moves, the participants count the points and determine the winner.

boardgame.name: Fire on the Sindalian Main
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Outrim Void is a dangerous place, rife with the remnants of ancient civilisations, pirate havens and ravenous aliens waiting to surge across borders into unclaimed territory. Its only hope for survival is the narrow stream of stars known as the Sindalian Main. If the secure flow of trade can be restored there, the region might one day rise above its blighted circumstances.

The Travellers are sent deep into the Void when they are assigned to the remote Imperial Navy base at Dpres. There they must take command of a joint-force task group and proceed along the Sindalian Main to Tktk. Their mission is to interdict the planet to protect its native sophont species, the tktks.

They soon discover that the Outrim Void is far different from Imperial space. Once you leave home port you enter a wild frontier. On the way to Tktk the Travellers must handle a plethora of problems including assisting colonists, protecting Imperial corporate interests, navigating the complex politics of the region, and possibly staving off an alien invasion. In addition, they must somehow manage to keep the task group fuelled and supplied without the ready assistance of the Imperium. Their objectives quickly expand and threaten to derail the primary mission. Fire on the Sindalian Main puts the Travellers to the test. The glory and honour of the Imperial Navy is at stake!

Fire on the Sindalian Main includes the following:


A complete naval mission using the Naval Campaign Sourcebook rules
The Tyrian Kæsia-class Orbital Bombardment Destroyer
The Glorious Empire’s Elar Kha'yaheh-class Multi-Purpose Fighter


Requires The Pirates of Drinax and Element Class Cruisers: Shipbuilder’s Blueprints.

Additional information from the publisher's web site:

The Travellers are sent deep into the Void when they are assigned to the remote Imperial Navy base at Dpres. There they must take command of a joint-force task group and proceed along the Sindalian Main to Tktk. Their mission is to interdict the planet to protect its native sophont species, the tktks.

boardgame.name: Loco Motive
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Made during a two-weeks game jam, Loco Motive is a short point-and-click adventure game set on a luxury train in Switzerland. A rich old lady, about to reveal her will, gets killed while the train rides through a dark tunnel and as her attorney, it's your job to solve the crime.

boardgame.name: Bernpyle #3 (February 2021)
boardgame.description:
Bernpyle #3 Is an unofficial Mausritter zine and it is packed full of fun content. In this issue you will find a drop in ready adventure site. This site is a whole hex you can add to your Mausritter world. The adventure is titled, The Murky Mysteries of Mice in Marshes. This adventure focuses a mysterious swamp know as Froschsumpf Marsh, this swamp is ancient and full of rumors and history. Currently, the few mice that reside in the marsh make their home in Coypu; and the frogs have their empire. But both these sets of denizens need be on the watch as there is a mysterious tarantula witch haunting the murky waters. Her name, 'Ol Spindlelegs. If your mice seek adventure, this swamp is beckoning them, that is, if they are brave enough to wade in these dark, damp and ancient waters.

This zine also holds a retelling and english translation of Homer's The Battle of the Frogs and the Mice. This greek satire sets the backdrop for the current climate of Froschsumpf Marsh. Included in this zine is stunning and amazing artwork by Alex Damaceno, @gnarledmonster. Alex has created amazing pieces of art! Bernpyle #3 also features several "mouse-rule" and tables inspired by conversations on the Mausritter Discord.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Adventure - The Murky Mysteries of Mice in Marshes
The Battle of the Frogs and Mice
Items for inventory Found in This Zine

boardgame.name: Cave Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A simple tabletop rpg where you play explorers in a philosophical world, uncovering hidden truths and getting in debates. The cave can be a metaphor if you'd like.

boardgame.name: Dead Mall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The basic concept is that you and your friends have somehow wound up in an abandoned mall. While looking for cool stuff, a place to party, or shit to vandalize, you stumble upon something wrong… horribly, horribly wrong. From then on you must navigate the mall and its monsters, with no weapons, your wits, and left over detritus from the mall to help you survive.

boardgame.name: Firewater
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Broke and not a nickel to spare. How about help Pappy run some moonshine across the county line ?

You and Bubba are distillers of the finest Firewater this side of the creek bridge. If you can just keep the local law and those pesky G- Men from finding the golden still. Oh yeah, don't forget that unseen Sasquatch rumored to be treading the swamps nearby Coon Dog Holler.

boardgame.name: Fortean
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What goes bump in the night? What happens after death? Why is it raining fish? These questions and more can be answered with this simple rules set and three four-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Saladin
boardgame.description:
Saladin is the first game of the series "En Ordre de Bataille" which will present for each volume a legendary medieval leader and two battles in which he has shown himself.

When the game meets History:

Saladin is a game intended to recreate the famous battles of Hattin and Arsuf where Saladin was opposed to the crusaders troops of Guy de Lusignan and then to those of Richard the Lionheart. With Saladin take charge of one of the armies that fought each other. Order your horsemen to harass the crusaders ranks or launch a devastating charge with your heavily armored knights. Saladin is an epic game for history and strategy fans.

Will you be able to lead your men to victory?

Saladin is a historical wargame for 2 players. Having chosen one of the two battle scenarios and set up the game, each player, in turn, will order one of their Banners. He will make them fight in order to disorganize those of their opponent. For this it will be necessary to spend Order tokens, the number of which will decrease at the beginning of each turn.
The player who will manage to preserve the cohesion of his troops by retaining the precious Order tokens will be declared the winner.

listing.notes: New copy in shrink.
Played once.

boardgame.name: Galaxy Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Who are you? A down-on-your-luck goon looking for fame and fortune. There are many travelers and hitchhikers that ventures the different realms and beyond, and you are one of them.

boardgame.name: A Goon's Guide to the Galaxy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Not sure what to do with your space career?

Venture the different realms and beyond with this handy guide to space adventures in the year 24XX!
boardgame.rpg: A Goon's Guide to the Galaxy

boardgame.name: Gin Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So's youse wanna be a made man huh? Have fun during the era of Prohibition? We's gotcha covered! Become a Gin Goon!
...
[Includes some system] modifications to let you play multiple sessions.

boardgame.name: Go On, Tunnelers!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are rebels that live in the Deep Underground, and when the game starts you are running from a wrangler cop and their swarm of three killbots. One of you is the MC, who describes the consequences of the rebels’ actions and establishes threats. The others play rebels.

boardgame.name: Д'Артаньян и три мушкетера
boardgame.description:
Д’Артаньян и три мушкетера, D'Artagnan and the Three Musketeers is a team-based game for the whole family.

Relive the thrilling adventures of four friends who traveled from Paris to London to retrieve the Queen's pendants.

One against all, all against one!

boardgame.name: Pay Off
boardgame.description:
Pay Off is played on a 6x6 grid where the spaces are labeled with all the possible rolls of two standard dice. On a turn a player rolls three dice and chooses two of them to designate an uncontrolled space, which they mark. Rerolls are done if necessary and rolling triples lets a player take any open space.

When a player takes a space adjacent to spaces they already control, they score points based on the number of such spaces. When all spaces have been marked off the player with the most points wins.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games
boardgame.boardgameversion: 6-Pack of Paper and Pencil Games edition

boardgame.name: Jeu du chouval twa pat et Mémory: les animaux de la Martinique
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu du chouval twa pat is a variation of mistigri with a Martinique touch. Play with local animals whose names are written in French and Creole.

The cards can also be used to play a Memory version.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Goblyns Deep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A complete RPG in only two pages, Goblyns Deep is a hack meant to be used as a quick one-shot, or to turn the typical game on it's head. Players play goblins defending their caves, grottoes, dungeons, or ruins from the invasion of outsiders - dwarves, elves, and human adventurers, as well as competing orcs and more dire foes! A bit tongue in cheek dark humor, all goblyn shenanigans.... err, heroics!

boardgame.name: Loose Change
boardgame.description:
Loose Change is played on a diamond-shaped board of spaces with eight connections to their neighbors (except on the edges of the board). One player plays with four pennies and a nickel showing heads, the other with four nickels and a penny showing tails.

On a turn a player moves any one of their coins any number of unoccupied spaces in any direction.

The object is to form a line containing exactly three pennies and no nickels; the pennies do not have to be adjacent, and at least one must belong to the opposing player.

Variants are given involving different winning conditions and sets of coins to use.

boardgame.name: Goon Breath
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A referee controls and describes the world to players who then describe how their characters act in the world.
...
Your character has 10 health points.

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Critérium international
boardgame.description:
The Critérium International is 3-stage race.
From 2010 to 2016, it took place around Porto-Vecchio, in Corsica.

boardgame.name: Goon Fighter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here comes a new challenger!

One or two players take part as Fighters in this year's Deadly Encounter Tournament. The contest held in the Most Venerated Republic of Sinosia.

boardgame.name: Goons & Dragons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Goons & Dragons is a simple tabletop RPG...with a fantasy thematic and a very versatile spell system.

In the manual you will find the rules to create characters, magical items and weapons and other several rules. Also, an short bestiary with some essentials fantasy beasts.

User summary:

The game is published as three PDF files:

10-page rules
1-page character sheet
2-page GM sheets

boardgame.name: Command? A Game About Learning Dungeon World
boardgame.description:
Ever want to learn how to play tabletop RPGs but weren't sure where to start? Understand the basics of one but aren't sure how to apply them in a real game? Or just want a fun time rolling dice? Then Command? is here for you!

Command? is a solo, gamemaster-less game in a zine built to teach you how to play tabletop RPGs! This campaign is for Command? Dungeon World, and is designed to take you through Sage LaTorra and Adam Koebel's RPG of classic fantasy, giving you a taste of what the game can offer budding roleplayers! With mechanics similar to the old Fighting Fantasy books of eld, all you need is the zine, a character sheet, and dice! Or a notepad and a dice rolling app! Or a text file and a random number generator! Or...

boardgame.name: Goons in Toyland!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What is a Toy Goon?

Toy Goons are toys that have been born or made heartier. Unlike most Goons, Toy Goons are toys that have been especially empowered by the love and imagination of a child. This magic can bring life to toys, but generally, a Toy Goon is a favorite of the child. With this in mind, Toy Goons are usually recognized among the toy community as the protectors of their “realm”.

boardgame.name: Goose Moose Chimera
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[Y]ou play an unholy combination of two of nature's most vicious monsters: half goose, half moose, and all bad. Run wild! Fight owlbears! Grow a fire-breathing goat head out of your armpit!

boardgame.name: Blokk!
boardgame.description:
ARCHITECTS ASSEMBLE!

In Blokk! you are the Architect and must build the perfect cube. Test your logic and problem-solving skills by using the game's 360° rotating stand, and construct The Cube based on the stencil in play - this is a process known as The Build.
The game has 36 unique 3D coloured blocks where Architects can select only one block on their turn. Players must choose one out of three construct modes per game:
Free Blokk! - Architects choose a block of their choice on each turn
Dice Blokk! - Architects roll a six-sided dice and play the color rolled per turn
Card Blokk! - Architects draw from the deck and play the block on their card each turn
These modes can be played either solo, or with friends and family in a co-op or versus game. Architects can also complete various difficulty challenges and unlock mystery blocks.
A game is completed once the Architects have come as close to a perfect cube as possible based on the stencil in play.
The Architect with the fewest imperfections wins!

Dare to be square.
-description from designer

boardgame.name: Guns & Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Get your horse saddled up and fight a swamp demon and some banditos, Tunnel Goons style.

boardgame.name: Off the Line
boardgame.description:
At the beginning of an operation, the commanding officer determines the point from which the operation will begin. This is referred to as the line of departure. In this game, players discover what happens once the soldiers under their command move ... Off the Line.

Off the Line is a wargame of low-to-moderate complexity that depicts man-to-man combat during World War II. Each combat unit represents a single soldier. Games are won through the completion of mission objectives such as the control of locations on the map board, exiting soldiers from the map through specific points, or the simple elimination of enemy soldiers. Although players are open to maneuver their forces as they wish, they’ll soon find that traditional tactics for units at the game’s scale are the best bet to achieve goals and to keep their forces intact.

Game play is managed through the use of a shared deck of action cards, each of which is used to determine how many soldiers might be activated during a turn, the resolution of random outcomes such as combat and morale checks, and random events. Being able to manage limited resources is a key to victory.

Each soldier is individually named and rated for morale (which determines a soldier’s effectiveness under fire), melee, weapon, and in some instances, command. Terrain is represented through the use of twelve geomorphic map panels that can create hundreds of different battlefield configurations.

This initial game includes forces for the United States and Germany facing off through twelve individual scenarios, plus instructions on how to create your own. Plans are in place to add additional nationalities, more maps, and lots more scenarios!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hoser
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hoser is a two player narrative-heavy tabletop role playing game about amateur hockey. One player is THE GOON, a thug whose only talent is fighting. The other player acts as THE REFEREE, and helps move the story forward by assuming the role of everyone else in the goon’s life.

boardgame.name: League of Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In League of Goons you'll portray the Superheroes immortalized in the Golden Age of Comics of the 1930’s and 40’s. You will battle against nefarious villains with plots too dastardly to detail here.

User summary:

The game is published as two PDF files:

3-page rules
1-page character sheet

boardgame.name: Presidents Versus
boardgame.description:
Presidents Versus is an action-packed, fun-filled, 30-minute card game for 1-4 players. America is in peril, and the presidents – from George Washington to Barack Obama – have all come back together to save us! Playable options for the “Big Bad” they’re saving us from include a pandemic, dictators, monsters, aliens and more. But while the portal to the past was open, the villains of American history – from Benedict Arnold to Bull Connor – have come back to stop the presidents and ensure America’s downfall. The battle for our country is on!

Publisher’s product page

The core of the game is 24 presidents, divided up evenly among the players. At the beginning of the game, you select a Big Bad that’s trying to destroy America. Every turn, you draw five cards out of your deck and play them. Each president has a presidential power based on that president’s actual strengths (such as popularity, party building or policy leadership). Presidents can also join forces to attack villains together, or recruit new cards into your deck. You can add to your deck cards that represent support from other presidents (hello, Millard Fillmore!), constitutional provisions that give powers to the presidency, and other forces from American history. These support cards interact with keywords on your presidents and other game factors, giving you tactical choices.

The players use their attacks to capture 12 villains from American history. Then it’s time for the Final Showdown with the Big Bad that’s trying to destroy America, represented by a set of threat cards. The rules for the Final Showdown are different for each Big Bad – fighting off a pandemic and fighting off monsters require different tactics! If the Big Bad defeats your presidents, it wins; if you defeat it first, the player with the most captured villains and Big Bad threat cards wins. So there’s pressure to be capturing villains for the whole game, but victory still hangs on that Final Showdown.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lichadores
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a far off world, millennia before the present day, the fantastic nation of Puroesia is ruled by the White Guardians: a faceless, totalitarian regime that stifles all creativity and joy. A generation ago, the White Guardians completed their conquest by slaughtering the wrestlers who entertained the common folk and casting their bodies into a deep, dark pit.

User summary:

The two PDF version have identical content - with formatting for different types of printing.

boardgame.name: Loot Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are Loot Goons. You live in weird underground places filled with junk that came from the Uplands. Some of it is magical. Most of it is dangerous. You don't really know where it came from, who put it here, or why.

There are monsters and other things in the Downlands with you. Sometimes they're guarding new junk.

Do with that information what you will.

boardgame.name: Lords of Mars
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lords of Mars, Ashcan Edition


Adventure on a dying world in the spirit of Edgar Rice Burroughs’ A Princess of Mars.
Explore the dead sea bottoms where ravaging tribes of green Martians lay claim to the cities of your ancestors. Delve into ancient tunnels in search of secret treasures or nefarious spies. Fly through the Martian skies on an airship, dodging sand storms and splider swarms!
Lords of Mars features a rules light system that is easy to learn and quick in play. Requires only two six-sided dice per player.
Also packed into this modest rulebook is a system for conflicts between airships and massive land battles between hundreds or even thousands of warriors.
The game is yours! What will you do as one of the Lords of Mars?

boardgame.name: Mainframe
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the psychedelic shared hallucination of cyberspace—Mainframe—AI programs roam freely. Self-replicating and self-editing, they've turned our shared online consciousness into a deep dream, observing us to simulate anything we might want to do in the digital playground we now inhabit.

Mainframe is a cyberpunk hack of Tunnel Goons in which you play as mercenaries who specialize in hunting down and capturing or deleting corporate AI programs. You have no body, your consciousness permanently wired into Mainframe. Each session is a mission to find and deal with one of these programs.

Explore the never-ending surreal servers of Mainframe as you fight to stop megacorporations from taking control of cyberspace entirely.

boardgame.name: Nostalgia Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beware your memories.

They can fool you, my daughter. They can kill you, my son.

We are condemned to roam the corridors of Nostalgia, but we can choose to overcome it's perils. Some rooms are made of foolishness and some others are made of oblivion. Look for the Coffee Shops, my dear. Maybe you can find poets over there and this will heal your hopes.

boardgame.name: Roadtrip! Goons on Vacation
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a fun, light-hearted game designed to allow players to recreate movies like National Lampoon’s Vacation series, Planes, Trains, and Automobiles, Road Trip, and Wild Hogs. The referee controls and describes the world to players who then describe how their characters act in the world.

boardgame.name: Making Golems
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Mortals can't create life from nothing, but we can come close.

- Simple, system-agnostic rules for golem NPCs/followers
- Lists for making avant-garde golem designs
